transcripts.text: You'll see crime rates spike, mental health issues spike every time.  this thing goes crazy.
I'm a ex-military meteorologist.  I served in the Navy.  I was trained by the U.S.  Air Force and the Navy.  I'm calling in to warn everybody.
Yeah, it definitely blew the heck off the sun, man.  It's a big one.

My name is Tammy Farrell.  I'm living in Western Kentucky.  I'm an ex-military meteorologist.  I served in the Navy.  I was trained by the U.S.  Air Force and the Navy to do my job.  And I'm calling in to warn everybody about how they need to start growing their own food and prepping for the grand solar minimum.
Since you have background in this, when do you think is all this is going to go down?  do you think that the military is prepping for this?  is this is why they're all going nuts or what?

well actually i served during the gulf war era and i was told about this back in the 90s that this was going to be going down.  when they first started throwing around the word um you know um climate change and global warming um um that for, you know, as trigger words, um, they, my chief laughed at me and they said, girl, it's going to get a lot colder before it gets warmer at that peak of warming in the nineties before we slide off the cliff into a mini ice age.  And within the next five years, um, we're going to have, um, severe storms, uh, food inflation, crop losses, um, globally.  And, um, if you watch, um, ADAPT 2030 or Ice Age Farmer or Oppenheimer Ranch Project, they have a lot of the white papers and a lot of the studies that will show you what I'm talking about.  And it's not just inclement weather and super storms, but we're going to have CMEs and coronal mass ejections and uptick in seismic activity.  So as far as my own personal go, I'm sorry, go ahead.

Well, no, what I was going to say is as far as the seismic activity, as far as the temperature ups and downs, somebody that I know very close that's higher up says that that it's all going to double and triple in the next couple of years.  And this was said to me like, what, eight, nine, 10 months ago now.

Well, it's cyclical, and actually the Farmers' Almanac, the reason they've been accurate for hundreds of years is because they use solar cycles and sunspot cycles to predict their weather rather than the traditional Copernicus effect meteorology that they use for short-term forecasts that uses the topography of the Earth to make the forecast.  So at the time, even with my top-tier clearance, I wasn't allowed the information to learn how to forecast with solar sunspot cycles because it was on a need-to-know basis.
Wait, so you're saying that the actual military said that it was a need-to-know basis forecasting?
Right, to learn how to do the forecasting using sunspot cycles.
That's really odd, don't you think?  I mean, what did you think back then?

Well, I helped run operations for the 7th Fleet in the Far East out of Yokosuka, Japan at the time.  I didn't ask questions.  I was low main on the totem pole.  I worked with the brass and the chiefs that did all the forecasts and ran operations, but I wasn't allowed to do the actual forecast, or if I did just a topography map or report of just using Copernicus effect meteorology to issue whether or not we could launch operations or a an aviator could take off, or a helicopter could take off.  I mean, they would even have to sign off on it, even though I did most of the work.  But that part of it was more considered long-term climate study.  And plus, back in the 90s, early 90s, this was 20 years off.  But here we are.  And climate change is real, but it's not caused by CO2 emissions.  It's caused by cyclical patterns of the sun dimming.  And all of this is being brought on for the lack of solar sunspot activity.  The sun is dying, waning.  What it is, we go over these slopes and go down the hills of peaking and cooling, peaking and cooling, but now these crescendos are going to get smaller and smaller and smaller, and we're not going to actually see a warming period like we saw in the 90s and early 2000s.  When we peak up again through the next 12 months, it's going to get a little bit warmer, but we're going to slide downhill even lower than where we hit this winter with our severe weather.  And this could, within five years, we could have... global famine.  We've already had global crop losses due to cold weather and natural disasters already.  We're already in the eddy minimum.  And we are overdue for what's called the Carrington event, which is where coronal mass ejection could affect our power grid.  We don't have the infrastructure to recover if that was to happen.  It's just a matter of time.  It's not a when, it's an if.

Okay, and the thing is, people didn't really realize, only the last 150, 200 years have we been dependent on this kind of power.  Not even 200 years.  The thing is, if these events happened before electricity, big deal, right?  But now we're talking everything is dependent on electricity.

Right.  Well, we're at a 400-year meeting point now to where there are several solar sunspot cycles that we're actually like in a grand solar minimum, so to speak.  The last thing, we won't be able to have seen this type of weather or destruction of crops as since... the Maunder minimum, and that was when Lewis and Clark was crossing the United States through the Rocky Mountains, and they have in their diaries reports of hailstones the size of Conestoga wagons coming down and destroying their groups and their gear and their livestock and their Conestoga wagons.  And also, too, back then, we were just laying the telegraph lines across the United States, and that's the only tech that we really had back then, and it wiped all those out.
What is up?  You are live on Marfugal TV.
This is Blue Kool-Aid.
Oh, hey, what's up, man?

That's what I heard.  Is there a good reference that I can pull up for everybody on the screen next to me?

Well, you know, well, by definition, it's... measured by hertz and it's low frequency.  it's supposed to be.  um you know 7.83 hertz is like what that is is you're getting wave a wave of frequency every.  you're getting 7.83 of them every second.  that's how that's measured.  so when that thing gets really really high there's a so-called healing frequency and it's supposed to be between 432 and 440.

You can't control what happens.  Even insurance has the act of God category.  There's just things you don't control.  You could be walking across the street and die.
